verses.verse: (Prayer to the Eternal King for Help) A prayer of one afflicted, when faint and pleading before the LORD. (1 Sam 9.16) Hear my prayer, O LORD; let my cry come to you.
(Ps 69.17; 71.2) Do not hide your face from me in the day of my distress. Incline your ear to me; answer me speedily in the day when I call.
(Job 30.30; Ps 31.10; Jas 4.14) For my days pass away like smoke, and my bones burn like a furnace.
(Ps 37.2) My heart is stricken and withered like grass; I am too wasted to eat my bread.
(Lam 4.8) Because of my loud groaning, my bones cling to my skin.
(Isa 34.11) I am like a desert owl (Meaning of Heb uncertain) of the wilderness, like a little owl of the waste places.
(Ps 38.11; 77.4) I lie awake; I am like a lonely bird on the housetop.
(Acts 23.12; 26.11) All day long my enemies taunt me; those who deride me use my name for a curse.
(Ps 42.3) Indeed, I eat ashes like bread and mingle tears with my drink,
because of your indignation and anger, for you have lifted me up and thrown me aside.
(v 4|PSA 102:4; Job 14.2) My days are like a lengthening shadow; I wither away like grass.
(Ps 135.13; Lam 5.19) But you, O LORD, are enthroned forever; your name endures to all generations.
(Ps 75.2; Isa 60.10) You will rise up and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to favor it; the appointed time has come.
For your servants hold its stones dear and have pity on its dust.
(1 Kings 8.43; Ps 138.4) The nations will fear the name of the LORD and all the kings of the earth your glory.
(Isa 60.1, 2) For the LORD will build up Zion; he will appear in his glory.
(Neh 1.6) He will regard the prayer of the destitute and will not despise their prayer.
(Ps 22.31; Rom 15.4) Let this be recorded for a generation to come, so that a people yet unborn may praise the LORD:
(Deut 26.15; Ps 33.13) that he looked down from his holy height, from heaven the LORD looked at the earth,
(Ps 79.11) to hear the groans of the prisoners, to set free those who were doomed to die,
(Ps 22.22) so that the name of the LORD may be declared in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem,
(Ps 86.9) when peoples gather together, and kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
(Job 21.21) He has broken my strength in midcourse; he has shortened my days.
(Isa 38.10; Hab 1.12) “O my God,” I say, “do not take me away at the midpoint of my life, you whose years endure throughout all generations.”
(Gen 1.1; Ps 96.5) Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.
(Isa 34.4; Mt 24.35; Rev 20.11) They will perish, but you endure; they will all wear out like a garment. You change them like clothing, and they pass away,
(Mal 3.6; Jas 1.17) but you are the same, and your years have no end.
(Ps 69.36; 89.4) The children of your servants shall live secure; their offspring shall be established in your presence.
